Authors: Luhukay D., Kurniawan Y., Trisnio K., Prasetyo A., Pricensia C., Putra E., Famadi S.
Title: Development of ONCOM (Online Community) platform: A conceptual model
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisnio, K., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prasetyo, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pricensia, C., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Famadi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to know and analyse community needs based on current situation and condition, we designing community portal to support information requirement about member registration, member data, community data and event data from a community and to know how a community portal can help storage and the delivery of information about user and event data required can be available quickly and accurately for the members of the community portal. The method used by the author is literature and field study. The author uses the field method to conduct interviews and conduct surveys to find supporting data that helps in the development of information systems portal community. Based on the results of the study, it was found that the designed community portal can help to know the business process of one of the existing community at this time, to help facilitate the community in managing new user candidates as well as old user and event data that has been going on and will take place and facilitate the community in doing storage and delivery of information to users quickly and accurately. © IAEME Publication.

Authors: Kurniawan Y., Jingga F., Prasetyo A.
Title: The Impacts of Social Media Facebook as Learning Media towards Learning Motivation for Students (A Case Study Approach)
Source title: Lecture Notes in Engineering and Computer Science
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Jingga, F., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia; Prasetyo, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research discusses the impacts between learning motivation and use of social media Facebook as a learning media. The benefits of this research for educators are expected to give feedback for them on the use of social media Facebook as a media for learning activities. The use of social media Facebook as a learning media will increase the motivation of non-regular students in learning activities. The main objective of this research is to analyze the impacts of the use of social media Facebook as a learning media for learning motivation of non-regular students. Method of data collection is use questionnaires given to 126 respondents to the category of non-regular students and the analysis of data using a single regression model. In this research, the authors tested a model and the results shows that the model receives H1 and reject H0. From the test results it can be concluded that the factor of use of social media Facebook as a learning media can increase learning motivation.
Index Keywords: Motivation; Regression analysis; Students; Surveys; Analysis of data; Case study approach; Data collection; Facebook; Learning Activity; Learning motivation; Regression model; Social media; Social networking (online)
References: Horton, W., (2012) E-Learning by Design, , USA: Pfeiffer; Malik, M., Parveen, N., Intrinsic Motivation of the High and Low Academic Achievers (2015) American Journal of Educational Research, 3 (11), pp. 1481-1483; Sugiyono, P.D., (2013) Metode Penelitian Bisnis (Pendekatan Kuantitatif, Kualitatif, Dan R&D), , Bandung: ALFABETA; Angus Stevenson, C.A.L., (2015) New Oxford American Dictionary, , http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/simulation, 12 January Online; Centeno, M.A., An Introduction to Simulation Modeling (1996) Proceedings of The 1996 Winter Simulation Conference, pp. 15-21; Sarwono, J., (2012) Metode Riset Skripsi Pendekatan Kuantitatif Menggunakan Prosedur SPSS, , Jakarta: PT Elex Media Komputindo; Lam, L., An Innovative Research on the usage of Facebook in the Higher Education context of Hong Kong (2012) The Electronic Journal of E-Learning, 10 (4), pp. 377-386
